metadata.title: CVE-2021-3446 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in libtpms in versions before 0.8.2. The commonly used integration of libtpms with OpenSSL contained a vulnerability related to the returned IV (initialization vector) when certain symmetric ciphers were used. Instead of returning the last IV it returned the initial IV to the caller, thus weakening the subsequent encryption and decryption steps. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-3446` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtpms0 - 0.8.2-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libtpms package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.8.2-1ubuntu1').
